title: Get live videos under an identity

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed value: application/json .

parameters.name: identity_type
parameters.description: Identity type. Enum values: TT_USER , BC_AUTH_TT . See Identities for details.

parameters.name: identity_authorized_bc_id Conditional
parameters.description: Required when identity_type is BC_AUTH_TT . ID of the Business Center that a TikTok Account User in Business Center identity is associated with.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Timestamp cursor. Live videos before the timestamp will be returned in reverse-chronological order. In the initial request, you can set it to 0 . The response will include a has_more flag and a cursor . If has_more is true , use the returned cursor in your subsequent request to obtain the following page of data.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Timestamp cursor. The time value of the last item returned according to the current request. You need to use this cursor value in your subsequent request to get the next live videos.

fields.name: finish_timestamp
fields.description: Finish timestamp for a live video. Example: 2023-12-07 08:13:44 .
